item.title: Rite Aid 破产计划获批，削减 20 亿美元债务
item.description: 美国一名破产法官周五批准了 Rite Aid 的重组计划，允许这家连锁药店削减 20 亿美元的债务，并将公司控制权移交给一组贷款人。【原文：A U.S. bankruptcy judge on Friday approved Rite Aid's restructuring plan, allowing the pharmacy chain to cut $2 billion in debt and turn over control of the company to a group of its lenders.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会起诉区块链软件技术公司 Consensys
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周五起诉加密货币公司 Consensys，称其未能通过 MetaMask 掉期服务注册为经纪人。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday sued cryptocurrency firm Consensys, alleging it has failed to register as a broker through its MetaMask swaps service.】

item.title: CDK 让部分经销商重新使用经销商管理系统
item.description: 软件生产商 CDK 周五表示，在网络攻击造成系统中断后，该公司的经销商管理系统已使两家小型经销商集团和一家大型上市经销商集团上线运行。【原文：Software maker CDK said on Friday it brought two small groups of dealers and one large publicly traded dealer group live on its dealer management system, following an outage caused by a cyber attack.】

item.title: 耐克计划推出售价低于 100 美元的运动鞋，以吸引注重价格的购物者
item.description: 耐克公司首席财务官周四表示，耐克将在全球各国推出 100 美元及以下的新款运动鞋，这家运动服装巨头正在调整其产品阵容，旨在使销售重回正轨。【原文：Nike will roll out new $100-and-under sneakers in countries around the world, its chief financial officer said Thursday, as the sportswear giant tweaks its product lineup in a plan aimed at getting sales back on track.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 就业、通胀数据或将打破美国国债市场窄幅震荡的局面
item.description: 即将发布的一系列经济报告和美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔的国会证词可能会使美国政府债券摆脱窄幅交易区间。【原文：A series of upcoming economic reports and Congressional testimony from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell could jolt U.S. government bonds out of a narrow trading range.】

item.title: 纽约联储称逆回购资金流入创年初以来最高水平
item.description: 本季度末，纽约联邦储备银行的逆回购机制在周五出现了大量资金流入。【原文：The quarter end saw substantial inflows into the Federal Reserve Bank of New York's reverse repo facility on Friday.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，申银万国保留香港 IPO 备选方案
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引知情人士的话报道称，尽管在线快速时尚集团Shein本月早些时候向英国金融监管机构提交了机密文件，但该公司仍保留了在香港上市的后备方案。【原文：Online fast-fashion group Shein is keeping alive a fallback option to list in Hong Kong despite filing confidential paperwork earlier this month with the UK's financial regulator, Financial Times reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称美国德豪律师事务所考虑关闭香港和北京办事处
item.description: 两位知情人士称，在资本市场长期低迷和中美关系日益紧张的背景下，在美国成立的德豪律师事务所正在考虑关闭其在香港和北京的办事处，成为在大中华区缩减规模的最新一家外国律师事务所。【原文：U.S.-founded law firm Dechert is considering closing its offices in Hong Kong and Beijing, becoming the latest foreign firm to scale back in Greater China, two people said, amid a prolonged capital market downturn and growing Sino-U.S. tensions.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司将购买雷诺和吉利热力发动机合资公司 10% 的股份
item.description: 中国汽车制造商雷诺和吉利的热力发动机合资企业 Horse Powertrain 周五表示，沙特阿美将持有该公司 10% 的股份。【原文：Saudi Aramco will take a 10% stake in Horse Powertrain, the thermal engine joint venture between Renault and Geely , the Chinese automaker said on Friday.】

item.title: 欧盟维斯塔格称，欧盟就微软、OpenAI、谷歌和三星的交易征求意见
item.description: 欧盟竞争事务主管玛格丽特-维斯塔格（Margrethe Vestager）周五表示，欧盟反垄断监管机构将就微软与 OpenAI 之间的合作以及谷歌与三星就三星设备达成的人工智能交易征求更多第三方的意见。【原文：EU antitrust regulators will seek additional third party views on the partnership between Microsoft and OpenAI as well Google's artificial intelligence deal with Samsung for Samsung devices, EU competition chief Margrethe Vestager said on Friday.】

item.title: 花旗集团敦促驳回前董事总经理的举报诉讼
item.description: 花旗集团敦促法官驳回一名前董事总经理提起的诉讼，该董事总经理指控银行解雇她是为了报复她拒绝向监管机构提供虚假信息。【原文：Citigroup urged a judge to dismiss a lawsuit by a former managing director who accused the bank of firing her in retaliation for refusing to give regulators false information.】

item.title: Trafigura 和贡渥集团的需求引发布伦特石油基准飙升
item.description: 贸易公司特拉菲古拉（Trafigura）和贡渥（Gunvor）在上周购买了九批支撑国际布伦特基准的原油，并竞购了更多原油，帮助推动了自2023年评估方式改变以来的最大涨幅。【原文：Trading houses Trafigura and Gunvor bought nine cargoes of crude that underpin the international Brent benchmark in the last week and bid for more, helping to drive the steepest gains since a change in the way it was assessed in 2023.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行任命新高管领导美国全球资产管理部门
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行（Royal Bank of Canada）任命杰西卡-劳施（Jessica Rausch）为美国全球资产管理（GAM）业务首席运营官，任命布兰登-卢（Brandon Lew）为总裁，自唐纳德-桑亚（Donald Sanya）被任命为首席执行官以来，该部门领导层焕然一新。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada has appointed Jessica Rausch as chief operating officer of its US global asset management (GAM) business and Brandon Lew as president in the division's new-look leadership since Donald Sanya's appointment as CEO.】

item.title: 美联储戴利："好消息 "通胀数据进一步证明政策 "足够紧缩
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周五表示，她相信通胀正在逐渐降温，并称最新数据显示4月至5月通胀率完全没有上升，这是 "政策正在发挥作用的好消息"。 "我们正在获得（政策）足够紧缩的证据，"戴利在接受CNBC采访时说。"在任何地方都看不到货币政策在起作用，这确实很有挑战性。【原文：San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank President Mary Daly on Friday said she believes inflation is gradually cooling, saying the latest data showing inflation did not rise at all from April to May is "good news that policy is working." "We are getting evidence that (policy) is tight enough," Daly told CNBC in an interview. "It's really challenging to look anywhere and not see monetary policy working.】

item.title: VIEW 美国 5 月通胀降温；消费支出温和增长
item.description: 美国 5 月份的物价保持不变，而消费者支出温和增长，这一趋势可能使美联储更接近于在今年开始降息。【原文：U.S. prices were unchanged in May while consumer spending rose moderately, a trend that could draw the Federal Reserve closer to start cutting interest rates this year.】

item.title: 美国股票基金在通胀数据公布前大幅流入
item.description: 在一份重要的通胀报告公布之前，美国投资者大量买入股票基金，因为他们预期通胀将继续放缓，这可能促使美联储宣布降息。【原文：U.S. investors heavily bought into equity funds ahead of a crucial inflation report spurred by expectations of continued moderation in inflation that could prompt the Federal Reserve to announce rate cuts.】

item.title: 通胀缓解，交易员增加美联储降息押注
item.description: 周五，市场押注美联储将在9月前降息，并在12月再次降息，因为一份政府报告显示，上个月衡量美国通胀的一项关键指标有所减弱。 与美联储政策利率挂钩的期货合约交易商目前认为，美联储在 9 月份会议前降息的概率约为 68%，高于此前的约 64%。【原文：Market bets rose on Friday that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by September and do so again in December after a government report showed a key measure of U.S. inflation weakened last month. Traders of futures contracts tied to the Fed policy rate now see about a 68% chance of a rate cut by the Fed's September meeting, up from about 64% earlier, after the data showed inflation by the p】

item.title: 美国 5 月通胀降温；消费支出温和增长
item.description: 美国 5 月份的物价保持不变，而消费者支出温和增长，这一趋势可能使美联储更接近于在今年开始降息。【原文：U.S. prices were unchanged in May while consumer spending rose moderately, a trend that could draw the Federal Reserve closer to start cutting interest rates this year.】

item.title: 加拿大经济 4 月份增长 0.3%；5 月份有望再增长
item.description: 周二的数据显示，由于批发贸易和制造业等行业的增长反弹，加拿大4月份的国内生产总值增长了0.3%，符合市场预期。【原文：Canada's gross domestic product increased 0.3% in April, matching market expectations, as growth rebounded in sectors including wholesale trade and manufacturing, and the economy likely expanded further in May, data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: Polestar报告2023年收入下降，电动汽车制造商正努力应对需求放缓
item.description: 瑞典电动汽车制造商 Polestar 在推迟数月提交财务报告后于周五表示，由于其高价车型需求放缓，该公司 2023 年的收入下降了约 3%，亏损扩大。【原文：Swedish EV-maker Polestar said on Friday, after months of delays in turning in its financial reports, that its 2023 revenue fell about 3% and its losses widened as it grappled with slowing demand for its higher-priced models.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔金：消费需求稳健但不繁荣
item.description: 里士满联储主席托马斯-巴尔金（Thomas Barkin）周五表示，尽管家庭对价格开始变得更加敏感，但美国的消费需求依然稳健。【原文：U.S. consumer demand is still solid although households are beginning to get more sensitive to prices, Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国 NHTSA 对超过 12 万辆本田美国汽车展开召回调查
item.description: 美国汽车安全监管机构周五表示，已对超过12万辆本田Ridgeline美国汽车的后视摄像头（RVC）故障展开召回调查。【原文：The U.S. auto safety regulator said on Friday it has opened a recall query into over 120,000 Honda Ridgeline U.S. vehicles over rear-view camera (RVC) failures.】

item.title: 特姆公司和谢因公司被勒令在 7 月 12 日前提供有关遵守欧盟技术规则的信息
item.description: 在接到消费者机构的投诉后，欧盟技术监管机构命令中国快时尚电子商务零售商特慕（Temu）和在中国创办的同行申银（Shein）在 7 月 12 日之前提供有关如何遵守欧盟在线内容规则的详细信息。【原文：Chinese fast-fashion e-commerce retailer Temu and China-founded peer Shein were ordered by EU tech regulators to provide details on how they comply with EU online content rules by July 12 following complaints by consumer bodies.】

item.title: 全球股票基金创三个多月来最大单周流入量
item.description: 在截至 6 月 26 日的七天里，全球股票基金创下了三个多月来最大的单周资金流入量，这主要是受美国通胀水平放缓的预期所推动，这种预期可能导致美联储宣布降息。【原文：Global equity funds had their biggest weekly inflows in more than three months in the seven days to June 26, driven by expectations of moderating U.S. inflation levels that could lead the Federal Reserve to announce interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 俄罗斯 VTB 银行称美国制裁使跨境交易复杂化
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大银行 VTB 的财务总监周五表示，美国本月对莫斯科实施的制裁使俄罗斯银行的外贸业务复杂化，但它们正在逐步适应新的现实。【原文：U.S. sanctions imposed on Moscow this month have complicated the foreign trade operations of Russian banks, but they are gradually adapting to the new realities, the finance director of VTB , Russia's second-largest lender, said on Friday.】

item.title: 路透社调查：中国需求困境抵消中东风险，油价将保持稳定
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，由于对中国需求的担忧和主要产油国供应增加的前景抵消了地缘政治紧张局势带来的风险，2024 年下半年的油价不会有太大变化。【原文：Oil prices will not change much in the second half of 2024 as concerns around demand from China and prospects of higher supply from key producers counter risks from geopolitical tensions, a Reuters poll indicated on Friday.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特将捐赠最多 53 亿美元的伯克希尔股份
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）周五表示，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）将向五个基金会捐赠高达 53 亿美元的股份。【原文：Warren Buffett will donate up to $5.3 billion of Berkshire Hathaway's shares to five foundations, the investment conglomerate said on Friday.】

item.title: 高管称金融业正努力应对人工智能的天赋和危险
item.description: 高管们表示，人工智能系统的普及为金融服务公司带来了巨大机遇，但资产管理公司也面临着比其他面向消费者的企业更高的风险，因为它们管理着敏感信息。【原文：The spread of artificial intelligence-based systems offers big opportunities for financial services firms, executives say, but asset managers also face higher stakes than other consumer-facing businesses because they manage sensitive information.】

item.title: 阿克曼的美国潘兴广场公司将在纽约上市，股票发行价为 50 美元
item.description: 由亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）管理的基金 Pershing Square USA 周五表示，计划在纽约首次公开发行股票，每股发行价为 50 美元。【原文：Pershing Square USA, a fund managed by billionaire Bill Ackman, said on Friday it plans to offer shares at $50 each in its initial public offering in New York.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，菲斯科将在美国召回 8,000 多辆 Ocean 汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周五表示，电动汽车公司菲斯科（Fisker）将在美国召回8204辆 "海洋"（Ocean）汽车，原因是该车的外门把手可能会被卡住而无法打开。【原文：Electric-vehicle firm Fisker is recalling 8,204 Ocean vehicles in the U.S. due to an issue where exterior door handles can stick and fail to open, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Friday.】
